snippet: A state district judge ruled that the way in which Louisiana finances the new program is unconstitutional. Gov. Bobby Jindal called the decision “wrongheaded” and vowed to appeal.
abstract: Louisiana Judge Timothy Kelley rules the way in which state finances its new education voucher program violates state Constitution, as it relies on money intended in 'plain and unambiguous' terms solely for public schools; Gov Bobby Jindal vows to appeal decision.
lead_paragraph: A state district judge ruled that the way in which Louisiana finances the new program is unconstitutional. Gov. Bobby Jindal called the decision “wrongheaded” and vowed to appeal.

headline.seo: Louisiana Voucher Program’s Financing Is Ruled Unconstitutional
headline.main: Judge Deals a Setback to Louisiana’s Voucher Program
headline.print_headline: Judge Deals a Setback to Louisiana’s Voucher Program
